hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition: Neutral-to-Bull Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 1-month ATM implied volatility below 50%, a subsequent 5% price breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound on above-average volume (>1.2x 30-day avg) will lead to a sustained volatility expansion where IV expands faster than RV, creating positive volatility carry for long gamma positions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility represent pent-up energy. Trump's crypto embrace creates asymmetric upside catalysts. Breakouts from low volatility environments tend to have momentum as short volatility positions get squeezed. JPMorgan's $170K BTC target suggests room for significant repricing.
entry_conditions: BTC price > 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound (+2σ)

exit_conditions.take_profit: IV/RV ratio reaches 1.3 or IV term structure inverts (front > back)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain (price returns below breakout level within 3 days) OR IV fails to expand relative to RV (IV/RV ratio remains <1.1)
